nodes.title: Site elements
nodes.body: The outer shells of the three cubic tombs have largely disintegrated. Only tiny coherent wall fragments are extant. None of the tombs appears to have been well aligned in the cardinal directions. The central chambers (reliquaries) of the tombs were carefully constructed.

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS1
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS1 (2 m x 2.7 m x 1 [maximum height]) has a partially intact central chamber, which measures 45 cm x 35 cm x 40 cm (depth).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS2
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS2 (2.1 m x 2.3 m x 70 cm) is located 15 m east of FS1 at the same elevation. The base of he central chamber is intact (50 cm x 80 cm x 35 cm [maximum depth]).

nodes.title: Funerary Structure FS3
nodes.body: Funerary structure FS3 (2 m x 1.5 m x 60 cm) is 4.5 m south of and 1.5 m lower than FS2. The fragmentary base of the central chamber is approximately the same size as that in FS2.
